mya.gloss: type genus of the family Myacidae

mya arenaria.gloss: an edible clam with thin oval-shaped shell found in coastal regions of the United States and Europe

myalgia.gloss: pain in a muscle or group of muscles

myanmar.gloss: a mountainous republic in southeastern Asia on the Bay of Bengal

myasthenia.gloss: a chronic progressive disease characterized by chronic fatigue and muscular weakness (especially in the face and neck)

myasthenia gravis.gloss: a chronic progressive disease characterized by chronic fatigue and muscular weakness (especially in the face and neck)

myasthenic syndrome.gloss: a disease seen in patients with lung cancer and characterized by weakness and fatigue of hip and thigh muscles and an aching back

mycelia sterilia.gloss: order of imperfect fungi having no known spore stage

mycenaean civilisation.gloss: the late bronze-age culture of Mycenae that flourished 1400-1100 BC

mycenaean civilization.gloss: the late bronze-age culture of Mycenae that flourished 1400-1100 BC

mycenaean culture.gloss: the late bronze-age culture of Mycenae that flourished 1400-1100 BC

mycobacteria.gloss: rod-shaped bacteria some saprophytic or causing diseases

mycobacterium.gloss: rod-shaped bacteria some saprophytic or causing diseases

mycophage.gloss: a person or animal who eats fungi (especially mushrooms)

mycophagist.gloss: a person or animal who eats fungi (especially mushrooms)

mycoplasmal pneumonia.gloss: an acute respiratory disease marked by high fever and coughing

mycoplasmataceae.gloss: pleomorphic Gram-negative nonmotile microorganism similar to both viruses and bacteria

mycosis.gloss: an inflammatory condition caused by a fungus

mycostatin.gloss: an antifungal and antibiotic (trade names Mycostatin and Nystan) discovered in New York State

mycrosporidia.gloss: an order in the subclass Cnidosporidia

mycteria.gloss: a genus of storks of the family Ciconiidae now including only the American wood ibis

mycteria americana.gloss: an American stork that resembles the true ibises in having a downward-curved bill

mycteroperca bonaci.gloss: large dark grouper with a thick head and rough scales

myctophidae.gloss: deep-sea fishes comprising the lantern fishes

mydriatic.gloss: a drug that causes the pupil of the eye to dilate

mydriatic drug.gloss: a drug that causes the pupil of the eye to dilate

myelin.gloss: a white fatty substance that forms a medullary sheath around the axis cylinder of some nerve fibers

myelin sheath.gloss: a layer of myelin encasing (and insulating) the axons of medullated nerve fibers

myelinated nerve fiber.gloss: a nerve fiber encased in a sheath of myelin

myeline.gloss: a white fatty substance that forms a medullary sheath around the axis cylinder of some nerve fibers

myelinisation.gloss: the development of a myelin sheath around a nerve fiber

myelinization.gloss: the development of a myelin sheath around a nerve fiber

myelocytic leukemia.gloss: a malignant neoplasm of blood-forming tissues

myeloid leukemia.gloss: chronic leukemia characterized by granular leukocytes

myenteric plexus.gloss: a plexus of unmyelinated fibers and postganglionic autonomic cell bodies in the muscular coat of the esophagus and stomach and intestines

myg.gloss: one ten thousandth of a centner

mylitta.gloss: Babylonian and Assyrian goddess of love and fertility and war

mym.gloss: a metric unit of length equal to 10,000 meters

myocardial infarct.gloss: destruction of heart tissue resulting from obstruction of the blood supply to the heart muscle

myocardial infarction.gloss: destruction of heart tissue resulting from obstruction of the blood supply to the heart muscle

myocardial inflammation.gloss: inflammation of the myocardium (the muscular tissue of the heart)

myocardiopathy.gloss: a disorder (usually of unknown origin) of the heart muscle (myocardium)

myocarditis.gloss: inflammation of the myocardium (the muscular tissue of the heart)

myocastor coypus.gloss: aquatic South American rodent resembling a small beaver

myoclonus epilepsy.gloss: epilepsy characterized by clonus of muscle groups and progressive mental deterioration and genetic origin

myodynia.gloss: pain in a muscle or group of muscles

myofibril.gloss: one of many contractile filaments that make up a striated muscle fiber

myofibrilla.gloss: one of many contractile filaments that make up a striated muscle fiber

myomorpha.gloss: true rats and mice and related rodents

myoneural junction.gloss: the junction between a nerve fiber and the muscle it supplies

myopia.gloss: (ophthalmology) eyesight abnormality resulting from the eye's faulty refractive ability

myosis.gloss: an acute infectious disease occurring in epidemic form and featuring paroxysms of pain (usually in the chest)
reflex contraction of the sphincter muscle of the iris in response to a bright light (or certain drugs) causing the pupil to become smaller

myositis trichinosa.gloss: infestation by trichina larvae that are transmitted by eating inadequately cooked meat (especially pork)

myosotis scorpiodes.gloss: small perennial herb having bright blue or white flowers

myosotis sylvatica.gloss: small biennial to perennial herb of Europe, northern Africa and western Asia having blue, purple or white flowers

myotactic reflex.gloss: reflex contraction of a muscle when an attached tendon is pulled

myotic.gloss: a drug that causes miosis (constriction of the pupil of the eye)
of or relating to or causing constriction of the pupil of the eye

myotic drug.gloss: a drug that causes miosis (constriction of the pupil of the eye)

myotis.gloss: largest and most widely distributed genus of bats

myotis leucifugus.gloss: the small common North American bat

myotis velifer.gloss: small bat of southwest United States that lives in caves etc.

myotonia atrophica.gloss: a severe form of muscular dystrophy marked by generalized weakness and muscular wasting that affects the face and feet and hands and neck

myotonia congenita.gloss: a mild, rare, congenital form of myotonia characterized by muscle stiffness

myotonic dystrophy.gloss: a severe form of muscular dystrophy marked by generalized weakness and muscular wasting that affects the face and feet and hands and neck

myotonic muscular dystrophy.gloss: a severe form of muscular dystrophy marked by generalized weakness and muscular wasting that affects the face and feet and hands and neck

myrcia.gloss: a genus of tropical American trees and shrubs of the myrtle family

myrciaria.gloss: a genus of tropical American trees and shrubs of the myrtle family

myriad.gloss: the cardinal number that is the product of ten and one thousand

myriagram.gloss: one ten thousandth of a centner

myriameter.gloss: a metric unit of length equal to 10,000 meters

myriametre.gloss: a metric unit of length equal to 10,000 meters

myriapoda.gloss: arthropods having the body composed of numerous double somites each with two pairs of legs: millipedes

myrica.gloss: deciduous aromatic shrubs or small trees

myrica cerifera.gloss: evergreen aromatic shrubby tree of southeastern United States having small hard berries thickly coated with white wax used for candles

myrica gale.gloss: bog shrub of north temperate zone having bitter-tasting fragrant leaves

myrica pensylvanica.gloss: deciduous aromatic shrub of eastern North America with grey-green wax-coated berries

myricaria.gloss: small genus of deciduous shrubs or subshrubs of southern Europe to Siberia and China

myringa.gloss: the membrane in the ear that vibrates to sound

myriophyllum.gloss: chiefly monoecious and usually aquatic herbs (as the milfoils)

myristic acid.gloss: a saturated fatty acid occurring naturally in animal and vegetable fats

myristica fragrans.gloss: East Indian tree widely cultivated in the tropics for its aromatic seed

myrmecophaga jubata.gloss: large shaggy-haired toothless anteater with long tongue and powerful claws

myrmeleon.gloss: type genus of the Myrmeleontidae: antlions

myrobalan.gloss: small Asiatic tree bearing edible red or yellow fruit

myrobalan plum.gloss: small Asiatic tree bearing edible red or yellow fruit

myroxylon.gloss: a genus of tropical American trees having pinnate leaves and white flowers

myroxylon balsamum pereirae.gloss: tree of South and Central America yielding an aromatic balsam

myroxylon pereirae.gloss: tree of South and Central America yielding an aromatic balsam

myroxylon toluiferum.gloss: medium-sized tropical American tree yielding tolu balsam and a fragrant hard wood used for high-grade furniture and cabinetwork

myrrh.gloss: aromatic resin that is burned as incense and used in perfume

myrrh tree.gloss: tree of eastern Africa and Asia yielding myrrh

myrrhis.gloss: European perennial herbs having pinnate leaves and umbels of white flowers

myrrhis odorata.gloss: European herb with soft ferny leaves and white flowers

myrsinaceae.gloss: family of Old World tropical trees and shrubs

myrsine family.gloss: family of Old World tropical trees and shrubs

myrtaceae.gloss: trees and shrubs yielding a fragrant oil

myrtillocactus.gloss: small genus of arborescent cacti of Mexico and Central America

myrtillocactus geometrizans.gloss: arborescent cactus of western Mexico bearing a small oblong edible berrylike fruit

myrtle.gloss: widely cultivated as a groundcover for its dark green shiny leaves and usually blue-violet flowers

myrtle family.gloss: trees and shrubs yielding a fragrant oil

myrtle flag.gloss: perennial marsh plant having swordlike leaves and aromatic roots

myrtle oak.gloss: small evergreen shrub or tree of southeastern United States

myrtus communis.gloss: European shrub with white or rosy flowers followed by black berries

mysis.gloss: type genus of the family Mysidae

mysoline.gloss: an anticonvulsant (trade name Mysoline) used to treat grand mal seizures and essential tremor

mysore thorn.gloss: spreading thorny shrub of tropical Asia bearing large erect racemes of red-marked yellow flowers

mystery.gloss: something that baffles understanding and cannot be explained
a story about a crime (usually murder) presented as a novel or play or movie

mystery novel.gloss: novel in which the reader is challenged to solve a puzzle before the detective explains it at the end

mystery story.gloss: a story about a crime (usually murder) presented as a novel or play or movie

mystic.gloss: someone who believes in the existence of realities beyond human comprehension
having an import not apparent to the senses nor obvious to the intelligence

mystic jewel.gloss: a member of the Taoist Trinity

mysticism.gloss: a religion based on mystical communion with an ultimate reality

mystification.gloss: confusion resulting from failure to understand

mystifier.gloss: a particularly baffling problem that is said to have a correct solution

mythical creature.gloss: a monster renowned in folklore and myth

mythical monster.gloss: a monster renowned in folklore and myth

mythical place.gloss: a place that exists only in imagination

mytilid.gloss: marine bivalve mollusk having a dark elongated shell
